column4: hello there, i'm trying to install some software from the installation cdrom, but the thing just doesn't work, i've ran "apt-cdrom add", it worked then i checked "/media/apt" and the cdrom is mounted, also it wrote the thing on /etc/apt/sources.list, but when i run apt-get it says "file not found".
nope, i can't use internet on that machine
any tutorial on how to install packages from the installation cd after installing only the base system?
have you tried a apt-get update?
what is the name of the package you're putting into apt-get install?
is there a deb package on the CD?
yes, all the debs are on subfolder of /pool/
ok, well the package that you need should be called xserver-xorg
